info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 10 at 11:58AM CST until November 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi TX
info.description:
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR MOST OF THE BRUSH COUNTRY ON TUESDAY...
.Relative humidity will drop through the day on Tuesday, reaching a minimum of 20-30% across portions of the Brush Country. In addition to dry conditions, southerly winds of 15-20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph will be present in the afternoon. Lastly, fuel moisture will be very dry in the less than 10th percentile.
The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Red Flag Warning for critical fire weather conditions, which is in effect from 10 AM to 6 PM CST Tuesday.
* AFFECTED AREA...La Salle, McMullen, Webb and Duval.
* TIMING...10 AM to 6 PM CST Tuesday
* WINDS...South 15-20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent.
* TEMPERATURES...Up to 78.
* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY FOR MODERATE TO STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS, CRITICALLY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND VERY DRY FUELS FOR DUVAL, MCMULLEN, LA SALLE, AND WEBB COUNTIES
